blocks.name: ckq
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the Kolmogorov quotient function.
blocks.origin: const class ckq { KQ }

blocks.name: diff.ckq.s
diff.ckq.c
diff.ckq.w
df-kq
blocks.content: Define the Kolmogorov quotient. This is a function on topologies which maps a topology to its quotient under the topological distinguishability map, which takes a point to the set of open sets that contain it. Two points are mapped to the same image under this function iff they are topologically indistinguishable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)

thm qtopval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(co(c0, cqtop, c2), crab(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c4)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0))))
  -| wceq(c4, cuni(c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(co(c0, cqtop, c2), crab(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c4)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0)))), diffsc(s0, c1))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(co(c0, cqtop, c2), crab(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c4)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0))), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe))
  elex(c0, c1)
  elex(c2, c3)
  mpd3an3(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wceq(co(c0, cqtop, c2), crab(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c4)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0))), wcel(crab(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c4)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0)), universe))
  adantl(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(crab(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c4)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0)), universe))
  3syl(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(crab(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c4)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0)), universe), wcel(cima(c2, c4), universe), wcel(cpw(cima(c2, c4)), universe))
  imaexg(c2, universe, c4)
  pwexg(cima(c2, c4), universe)
  rabexg(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c4)), universe, wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0))
  ovmpt2ga(hs0, hs1, c0, universe, c2, universe, crab(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c4)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0)), universe, cqtop, crab(s0, cpw(cima(cv(hs1), cuni(cv(hs0)))), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(cv(hs1)), cv(s0)), cuni(cv(hs0))), cv(hs0))))
  rabeqbidv(s0, cpw(cima(cv(hs1), cuni(cv(hs0)))), cpw(cima(c2, c4)), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(cv(hs1)), cv(s0)), cuni(cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0))
  pweqd(cima(cv(hs1), cuni(cv(hs0))), cima(c2, c4), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  imaeq12d(cv(hs1), cuni(cv(hs0)), c2, c4, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  eleq12d(cin(cima(ccnv(cv(hs1)), cv(s0)), cuni(cv(hs0))), cv(hs0), cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  ineq12d(cima(ccnv(cv(hs1)), cv(s0)), cuni(cv(hs0)), cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  imaeq1d(ccnv(cv(hs1)), cv(s0), ccnv(c2), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  cnveqd(cv(hs1), c2, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  simpr(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  syl6eqr(cuni(cv(hs0)), c4, cuni(c0), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  unieqd(cv(hs0), c0, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  simpl(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  df-qtop(hs0, hs1, s0)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, cima(c2, c4))
  diff.cima.s(s0, c2, c4)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(crab(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c4)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0)))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(universe)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(crab(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c4)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c4), c0)))
  diff.cpw.s(s0, cima(cv(hs1), cuni(cv(hs0))))
  diff.cima.s(s0, cv(hs1), cuni(cv(hs0)))
  diff.cuni.s(s0, cv(hs0))
  diff.wa.s(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs1), c2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

thm qtopval2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)), wceq(co(c0, cqtop, c2), crab(s0, cpw(c4), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c0))))
  -| wceq(c5, cuni(c0))

  -| diffsc(s0, c3)

  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
} = {
  eqtrd(co(c0, cqtop, c2), crab(s0, cpw(c4), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c0)), crab(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c5)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c5), c0)), w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)))

  simp1(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5))

  ssexd(c3, c5, universe, w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)))
  syl5eqel(c5, universe, cuni(c0), w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)))

  fex(c2, c3, c4, universe)

  rabeqbidv(s0, cpw(cima(c2, c5)), cpw(c4), w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c5), c0), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c0))
  pweqd(cima(c2, c5), c4, w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)))
  eqssd(cima(c2, c5), c4, w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)))
  syl5sseq(cima(c2, c5), c4, crn(c2), w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)))
  imassrn(c2, c5)
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5), wceq(crn(c2), c4))
  forn(c2, c3, c4)
  eqsstr3d(c4, cima(c2, c5), cima(c2, c3), w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5), wceq(cima(c2, c3), c4))
  foima(c2, c3, c4)
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)), wss(cima(c2, c3), cima(c2, c5)), wss(c3, c5))
  imass2(c3, c5, c2)
  eleq1d(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c5), c0, cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)))
  sylib(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)), wceq(cin(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c5), cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0))), wss(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c5))
  sstrd(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(s0)), c5, c3, w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, c4), wss(c3, c5)))

  imassrn(c2, c5)

blocks.name: qtopres
blocks.content: The quotient topology is unaffected by restriction to the base set. This property makes it slightly more convenient to use, since we don't have to require that ` F ` be a function with domain ` X ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm qtopres(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

} = {

  expcom(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, universe), wceq(co(c2, cqtop, c0), co(c2, cqtop, cres(c0, c3))))
  3eqtr4a(co(c2, cqtop, c0), co(c2, cqtop, cres(c0, c3)), crab(hs0, cpw(cima(c0, c3)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c0), cv(hs0)), c3), c2)), crab(hs0, cpw(cima(cres(c0, c3), c3)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(cres(c0, c3)), cv(hs0)), c3), c2)), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c0, c1)))

  rabeqi(hs0, cpw(cima(cres(c0, c3), c3)), cpw(cima(c0, c3)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(cres(c0, c3)), cv(hs0)), c3), c2))
  pweqi(cima(cres(c0, c3), c3), cima(c0, c3))
  resima(c0, c3)
  rabbii(hs0, cpw(cima(c0, c3)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(cres(c0, c3)), cv(hs0)), c3), c2), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(c0), cv(hs0)), c3), c2))

  cnveqi(cres(cres(c0, c3), c3), cres(c0, c3))
  residm(c0, c3)
  cnvresima(cres(c0, c3), c3, cv(hs0))
  cnvresima(c0, c3, cv(hs0))
  qtopval(hs0, c2, universe, c0, c1, c3)
  sylan2(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wceq(co(c2, cqtop, cres(c0, c3)), crab(hs0, cpw(cima(cres(c0, c3), c3)), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(cres(c0, c3)), cv(hs0)), c3), c2))), wcel(cres(c0, c3), universe))
  resexg(c0, c1, c3)

  ovprc1(c2, cqtop, c0)
  ovprc1(c2, cqtop, cres(c0, c3))
  reldmmpt2(hs1, hs2, cqtop, universe, universe, crab(hs0, cpw(cima(cv(hs2), cuni(cv(hs1)))), wcel(cin(cima(ccnv(cv(hs2)), cv(hs0)), cuni(cv(hs1))), cv(hs1))))

blocks.content: The quotient topology is a topology. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Mar-2015.)

thm qtoptop(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(co(c0, cqtop, c1), ctop))
  -| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))
} = {

  simpl(wcel(c0, ctop), wfn(c1, c2))
  syl2anr(wcel(c0, ctop), wfn(c1, c2), wcel(c1, universe), wfn(c1, c2), wcel(c2, c0))
  id(wfn(c1, c2))

  fnex(c1, c2, c0)
  adantl(wcel(c0, ctop), wfn(c1, c2), wfun(c1))
  fnfun(c1, c2)
  qtoptop2(c0, c1, universe)
}

  elqtop3(c0, c1, c2, crn(c2), cv(hs0))
  syldan(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wfn(c2, c1), wb(wcel(c2, co(c0, ccn, co(c0, cqtop, c2))), wa(wf(c2, c1, crn(c2)), wral(hs0, co(c0, cqtop, c2), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c0)))), wcel(co(c0, cqtop, c2), cfv(ctopon, crn(c2))))
  syldan(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wfn(c2, c1), wcel(co(c0, cqtop, c2), cfv(ctopon, crn(c2))), wfo(c2, c1, crn(c2)))
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wfn(c2, c1)), wfo(c2, c1, crn(c2)), wfn(c2, c1))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wfn(c2, c1))
  dffn4(c2, c1)
  qtoptopon(c0, c1, c2, crn(c2))
  iscn(hs0, c0, c1, co(c0, cqtop, c2), crn(c2), c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wfn(c2, c1)))

  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, cqtop, c2))

thm qtopid(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  âŠ¢ ((c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)âˆ§ c2[Fn]c1)â†’ c2 âˆˆ(c0[Cn](c0[qTop]c2)))
} = {
  mpbir2and((c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)âˆ§ c2[Fn]c1), c2 âˆˆ(c0[Cn](c0[qTop]c2)), (c2 : c1 â†’ ran(c2)), âˆ€(hs0 âˆˆ(c0[qTop]c2),(`' c2 " hs0)âˆˆ c0))
  syl((c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)âˆ§ c2[Fn]c1), (c2 : c1 â†’ ran(c2)), (c2 : c1 â†  ran(c2)))
  fof(c2, c1, ran(c2))
  ralrimiva(hs0, (c0[qTop]c2), (c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)âˆ§ c2[Fn]c1), (`' c2 " hs0)âˆˆ c0)
  simplbda((c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)âˆ§ c2[Fn]c1), hs0 âˆˆ(c0[qTop]c2), (`' c2 " hs0)âˆˆ c0, hs0 âŠ† ran(c2))
  syldan(c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1), c2[Fn]c1, (hs0 âˆˆ(c0[qTop]c2)â†”(hs0 âŠ† ran(c2)âˆ§(`' c2 " hs0)âˆˆ c0)), (c2 : c1 â†  ran(c2)))
  elqtop3(c0, c1, c2, ran(c2), hs0)
  syldan(c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1), c2[Fn]c1, (c2 âˆˆ(c0[Cn](c0[qTop]c2))â†”((c2 : c1 â†’ ran(c2))âˆ§ âˆ€(hs0 âˆˆ(c0[qTop]c2),(`' c2 " hs0)âˆˆ c0))), (c0[qTop]c2)âˆˆ(TopOn ` ran(c2)))
  syldan(c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1), c2[Fn]c1, (c0[qTop]c2)âˆˆ(TopOn ` ran(c2)), (c2 : c1 â†  ran(c2)))
  sylib((c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)âˆ§ c2[Fn]c1), (c2 : c1 â†  ran(c2)), c2[Fn]c1)
  simpr(c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1), c2[Fn]c1)
  dffn4(c2, c1)
  qtoptopon(c0, c1, c2, ran(c2))
  iscn(hs0, c0, c1, (c0[qTop]c2), ran(c2), c2)

blocks.name: idqtop
blocks.content: The quotient topology induced by the identity function is the original topology. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm idqtop(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wceq(co(c0, cqtop, cres(cid, c1)), c0))
} = {
  eqrdv(hs0, co(c0, cqtop, cres(cid, c1)), c0, wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)))
  3bitr4d(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cqtop, cres(cid, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wss(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cima(ccnv(cres(cid, c1)), cv(hs0)), c0)), wa(wss(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c0)))
  pm5.32da(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wss(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cima(ccnv(cres(cid, c1)), cv(hs0)), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
  eleq1d(cima(ccnv(cres(cid, c1)), cv(hs0)), c0, cv(hs0), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wss(cv(hs0), c1)))
  syl5eq(cima(ccnv(cres(cid, c1)), cv(hs0)), cv(hs0), cima(cres(cid, c1), cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wss(cv(hs0), c1)))
  imaeq1i(ccnv(cres(cid, c1)), cv(hs0), cres(cid, c1))
  cnvresid(c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wss(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cima(cres(cid, c1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs0)))
  resiima(cv(hs0), c1)
  mpdan(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cqtop, cres(cid, c1))), wa(wss(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cima(ccnv(cres(cid, c1)), cv(hs0)), c0))), wfo(cres(cid, c1), c1, c1))
  mp1i(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wfo(cres(cid, c1), c1, c1), wf1o(cres(cid, c1), c1, c1))
  f1oi(c1)
  f1ofo(cres(cid, c1), c1, c1)
  elqtop3(c0, c1, cres(cid, c1), c1, cv(hs0))
  pm4.71rd(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  ex(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  toponss(c0, c1, cv(hs0))
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, cqtop, cres(cid, c1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)))
}

blocks.name: qtopcmplem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ qtopcmp and ~ qtopconn . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm qtopcmplem(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wfn(c2, c3)), wcel(co(c0, cqtop, c2), c1))
  -| wceq(c3, cuni(c0))
  -| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, ctop))
  -| wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c2))), wcel(c2, co(c0, ccn, co(c0, cqtop, c2)))), wcel(co(c0, cqtop, c2), c1))
} = {
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wfn(c2, c3)), wcel(co(c0, cqtop, c2), c1), wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c2))), wcel(c2, co(c0, ccn, co(c0, cqtop, c2))))
  simpl(wcel(c0, c1), wfn(c2, c3))
  mpbid(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wfn(c2, c3)), wfo(c2, c3, cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c2))), wfo(c2, c3, crn(c2)))
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wfn(c2, c3)), wfo(c2, c3, crn(c2)), wfn(c2, c3))
  simpr(wcel(c0, c1), wfn(c2, c3))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wfn(c2, c3)), wb(wfo(c2, c3, crn(c2)), wfo(c2, c3, cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c2)))), wceq(crn(c2), cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c2))))
  sylan2b(wcel(c0, c1), wfn(c2, c3), wceq(crn(c2), cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c2))), wfo(c2, c3, crn(c2)))
  dffn4(c2, c3)
  sylan(wcel(c0, c1), wfo(c2, c3, crn(c2)), wceq(crn(c2), cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c2))), wcel(c0, ctop))
  qtopuni(c0, c2, c3, crn(c2))
  foeq3(crn(c2), cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c2)), c2, c3)
  sylan(wcel(c0, c1), wfn(c2, c3), wcel(c2, co(c0, ccn, co(c0, cqtop, c2))), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c3)))
  sylib(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c3)), wcel(c0, ctop))
  toptopon(c0, c3)
  qtopid(c0, c3, c2)
}

  âŠ¢ ((c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2[Fn]c3)â†’(c0[qTop]c2)âˆˆ c1)
  âŠ£ c3 = â‹ƒ c0

} = {

  sylib((c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2[Fn]c3), (c2 : c3 â†  ran(c2)), c2[Fn]c3)
  simpr(c0 âˆˆ c1, c2[Fn]c3)
  syl((c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2[Fn]c3), ((c2 : c3 â†  ran(c2))â†”(c2 : c3 â†  â‹ƒ(c0[qTop]c2))), ran(c2)= â‹ƒ(c0[qTop]c2))
  sylan2b(c0 âˆˆ c1, c2[Fn]c3, ran(c2)= â‹ƒ(c0[qTop]c2), (c2 : c3 â†  ran(c2)))
  dffn4(c2, c3)
  sylan(c0 âˆˆ c1, (c2 : c3 â†  ran(c2)), ran(c2)= â‹ƒ(c0[qTop]c2), c0 âˆˆ Top)

blocks.name: qtopcmp

blocks.name: qtopconn

thm qtopkgen(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(co(c0, cqtop, c1), crn(ckgen)))
  -| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))
} = {
  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(co(c0, cqtop, c1), crn(ckgen)), wcel(co(c0, cqtop, c1), ctop), wss(cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)), co(c0, cqtop, c1)))
  ssrdv(hs0, cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)), co(c0, cqtop, c1), wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)))
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cqtop, c1)))
  mpbir2and(wa(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cqtop, c1)), wss(cv(hs0), crn(c1)), wcel(cima(ccnv(c1), cv(hs0)), c0))
  sseqtr4d(cv(hs0), crn(c1), cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c1)), wa(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))))
  sseqtr4d(cv(hs0), cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c1)), cuni(cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1))), wa(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1))), wss(cv(hs0), cuni(cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))))
  elssuni(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))
  syl(wa(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))), wceq(cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c1)), cuni(cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))), wcel(co(c0, cqtop, c1), ctop))
  kgenuni(co(c0, cqtop, c1), cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c1)))

  syl2anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))), wceq(crn(c1), cuni(co(c0, cqtop, c1))), wcel(c0, ctop), wfo(c1, c2, crn(c1)))
  qtopuni(c0, c1, c2, crn(c1))
  sylancom(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1))), wcel(cima(ccnv(c1), cv(hs0)), c0), wcel(c1, co(c0, ccn, cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))))
  eleqtrd(c1, co(c0, ccn, cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1))), co(c0, ccn, co(c0, cqtop, c1)), wa(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))))
  syl2anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))), wcel(c1, co(c0, ccn, co(c0, cqtop, c1))), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c2)), wfn(c1, c2))
  sylib(wa(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c2)), wcel(c0, ctop))
  syl(wa(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))), wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)))

  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1))), wcel(co(c0, cqtop, c1), ctop))
  sylan(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2), wcel(co(c0, cqtop, c1), ctop), wcel(c0, ctop))
  kgentop(c0)

  syl2anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cqtop, c1)), wa(wss(cv(hs0), crn(c1)), wcel(cima(ccnv(c1), cv(hs0)), c0))), wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfo(c1, c2, crn(c1)))
  simpll(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1))))
  sylib(wa(wa(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))), wfo(c1, c2, crn(c1)), wfn(c1, c2))
  simplr(wcel(c0, crn(ckgen)), wfn(c1, c2), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1))))
  dffn4(c1, c2)

  diff.hs0.c(cfv(ckgen, co(c0, cqtop, c1)))

thm qtopkgen(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  âŠ¢ ((c0 âˆˆ ran(kGen)âˆ§ c1[Fn]c2)â†’(c0[qTop]c1)âˆˆ ran(kGen))

blocks.name: tgqtop
blocks.content: An injection maps generated topologies to each other. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: qtopss
blocks.content: A surjective continuous function from ` J ` to ` K ` induces a topology ` J qTop F ` on the base set of ` K ` . This topology is in general finer than ` K ` . Together with ~ qtopid , this implies that ` J qTop F ` is the finest topology making ` F ` continuous, i.e. the final topology with respect to the family ` { F } ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm qtopss(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, co(c1, ccn, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(ctopon, c3)), wceq(crn(c0), c3)), wss(c2, co(c1, cqtop, c0)))
} = {
  ssrdv(hs0, c2, co(c1, cqtop, c0), w3a(wcel(c0, co(c1, ccn, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(ctopon, c3)), wceq(crn(c0), c3)))
  ex(w3a(wcel(c0, co(c1, ccn, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(ctopon, c3)), wceq(crn(c0), c3)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cqtop, c0)))
  mpbir2and(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, co(c1, ccn, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(ctopon, c3)), wceq(crn(c0), c3)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cqtop, c0)), wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c0), cv(hs0)), c1))
  3ad2antl2(wcel(c0, co(c1, ccn, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(ctopon, c3)), wceq(crn(c0), c3), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wss(cv(hs0), c3))
  toponss(c2, c3, cv(hs0))
  3ad2antl1(wcel(c0, co(c1, ccn, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(ctopon, c3)), wceq(crn(c0), c3), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cima(ccnv(c0), cv(hs0)), c1))

blocks.name: qtopeu
blocks.content: Universal property of the quotient topology. If ` G ` is a function from ` J ` to ` K ` which is equal on all equivalent elements under ` F ` , then there is a unique continuous map ` f : ( J / F ) --> K ` such that ` G = f o. F ` , and we say that ` G ` "passes to the quotient". (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Mar-2015.)

blocks.name: qtoprest
blocks.content: If ` A ` is a saturated open or closed set (where saturated means that ` A = ( ``' F " U ) ` for some ` U ` ), then the restriction of the quotient map ` F ` to ` A ` is a quotient map. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: qtopomap
blocks.content: If ` F ` is a surjective continuous open map, then it is a quotient map. (An open map is a function that maps open sets to open sets.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Mar-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm qtopomap(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, cqtop, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, co(c1, ccn, c0)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(crn(c2), c3))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(cima(c2, cv(s0)), c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, cqtop, c2))), diffsc(s0, c3))
  eqssd(c0, co(c1, cqtop, c2), w0)
  syl3anc(w0, wss(c0, co(c1, cqtop, c2)), wcel(c2, co(c1, ccn, c0)), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c3)), wceq(crn(c2), c3))
  qtopss(c2, c1, c0, c3)
  ssrdv(hs0, co(c1, cqtop, c2), c0, w0)
  sylbid(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cqtop, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1)))
  syl2anc(w0, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cqtop, c2)), wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))), wcel(c1, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c1))), wfo(c2, cuni(c1), c3))
  elqtop3(c1, cuni(c1), c2, c3, cv(hs0))
  ex(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
  eqeltrrd(cv(hs0), c0, cima(c2, cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0))), wa(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))))
  adantrr(w0, wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1), wceq(cima(c2, cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)))
  sylan(w0, wss(cv(hs0), c3), wceq(cima(c2, cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)), wfo(c2, cuni(c1), c3))
  sylanbrc(w0, wfo(c2, cuni(c1), c3), wfn(c2, cuni(c1)), wceq(crn(c2), c3))
  ffnd(c2, cuni(c1), c3, w0)
  syl3anc(w0, wf(c2, cuni(c1), c3), wcel(c1, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c1))), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c3)), wcel(c2, co(c1, ccn, c0)))
  sylib(w0, wcel(c1, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c1))), wcel(c1, ctop))
  syl(w0, wcel(c1, ctop), wcel(c2, co(c1, ccn, c0)))
  cntop1(c2, c1, c0)
  toptopon2(c1)
  cnf2(c1, cuni(c1), c0, c3, c2)
  df-fo(c2, cuni(c1), c3)
  foimacnv(c2, cuni(c1), c3, cv(hs0))
  rspcdva(s0, cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1, wa(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))), wcel(cima(c2, cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0))), c0), wcel(cima(c2, cv(s0)), c0))
  eleq1d(cima(c2, cv(s0)), c0, cima(c2, cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0))), wceq(cv(s0), cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0))))
  imaeq2(cv(s0), cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c2)
  adantr(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1)), wral(s0, c1, wcel(cima(c2, cv(s0)), c0)))
  ralrimiva(s0, c1, w0, wcel(cima(c2, cv(s0)), c0))
  simprr(w0, wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))
  diff.hs0.c(co(c1, cqtop, c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cima(c2, cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0))), c0)
  diff.cima.s(s0, c2, cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)))
  diff.cima.s(s0, ccnv(c2), cv(hs0))
  diff.ccnv.s(s0, c2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: qtopcmap
blocks.content: If ` F ` is a surjective continuous closed map, then it is a quotient map. (A closed map is a function that maps closed sets to closed sets.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Mar-2015.)

thm qtopcmap(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, co(c1, cqtop, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c3)))

  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), cfv(ccld, c1))), wcel(cima(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(ccld, c0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  eqssd(c0, co(c1, cqtop, c2), w0)
  syl3anc(w0, wss(c0, co(c1, cqtop, c2)), wcel(c2, co(c1, ccn, c0)), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c3)), wceq(crn(c2), c3))
  qtopss(c2, c1, c0, c3)

  elqtop2(c1, ctop, c2, cuni(c1), c3, cv(hs0))
  ex(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0))

  sylancl(wa(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))), wceq(cima(c2, cima(ccnv(c2), cdif(c3, cv(hs0)))), cdif(c3, cv(hs0))), wfo(c2, cuni(c1), c3), wss(cdif(c3, cv(hs0)), c3))
  difss(c3, cv(hs0))
  foimacnv(c2, cuni(c1), c3, cdif(c3, cv(hs0)))
  difeq1d(c3, cv(hs0), cuni(c0), wa(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))))
  rspcdva(s0, cima(ccnv(c2), cdif(c3, cv(hs0))), cfv(ccld, c1), wa(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))), wcel(cima(c2, cima(ccnv(c2), cdif(c3, cv(hs0)))), cfv(ccld, c0)), wcel(cima(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(ccld, c0)))
  eleq1d(cima(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(ccld, c0), cima(c2, cima(ccnv(c2), cdif(c3, cv(hs0)))), wceq(cv(s0), cima(ccnv(c2), cdif(c3, cv(hs0)))))
  imaeq2(cv(s0), cima(ccnv(c2), cdif(c3, cv(hs0))), c2)
  adantr(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1)), wral(s0, cfv(ccld, c1), wcel(cima(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(ccld, c0))))
  ralrimiva(s0, cfv(ccld, c1), w0, wcel(cima(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(ccld, c0)))

  syl(wa(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))), wceq(cima(ccnv(c2), c3), cuni(c1)), wf(c2, cuni(c1), c3))
  adantr(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1)), wf(c2, cuni(c1), c3))
  syl3anc(w0, wf(c2, cuni(c1), c3), wcel(c1, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c1))), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c3)), wcel(c2, co(c1, ccn, c0)))

  toptopon2(c1)
  cnf2(c1, cuni(c1), c0, c3, c2)
  fimacnv(c2, cuni(c1), c3)
  syl2anc(wa(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))), wcel(cdif(cuni(c1), cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0))), cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(c1, ctop), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))
  adantr(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1)), wcel(c1, ctop))
  syl(w0, wcel(c1, ctop), wcel(c2, co(c1, ccn, c0)))
  cntop1(c2, c1, c0)

  syl(wa(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))), wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c3)))
  topontop(c0, c3)
  sseqtrd(cv(hs0), cuni(c0), c3, wa(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))))
  simprl(w0, wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))
  syl(wa(w0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cima(ccnv(c2), cv(hs0)), c1))), wceq(c3, cuni(c0)), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c3)))

  3adant3(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3), wceq(cfv(c5, c2), crab(s0, c0, wcel(c2, cv(s0)))))

  syl6bbr((c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ c3 âˆ§ c4 âˆˆ c3), (c5 ` c2)=(c5 ` c4), âˆ€(s0 âˆˆ c0,(c2 âˆˆ s0 â†” c4 âˆˆ s0)), { s0 âˆˆ c0 | c2 âˆˆ s0 } = { s0 âˆˆ c0 | c4 âˆˆ s0 })
  eqeq12d((c5 ` c2), (c5 ` c4), { s0 âˆˆ c0 | c2 âˆˆ s0 }, { s0 âˆˆ c0 | c4 âˆˆ s0 }, (c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ c3 âˆ§ c4 âˆˆ c3))
  3adant3(c0 âˆˆ c1, c2 âˆˆ c3, c4 âˆˆ c3, (c5 ` c2)= { s0 âˆˆ c0 | c2 âˆˆ s0 })
  kqfval(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c5)
  3adant2(c0 âˆˆ c1, c2 âˆˆ c3, c4 âˆˆ c3, (c5 ` c4)= { s0 âˆˆ c0 | c4 âˆˆ s0 })
  kqfval(s0, s1, c0, c1, c4, c3, c5)

blocks.name: kqffn
blocks.content: The topological indistinguishability map is a function on the base. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm kqffn(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wfn(c2, c3))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, c3, crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wfn(c2, c3)), diffss(s0, s1))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wfn(c2, c3)), diffsc(s1, c3))
  ffnd(c2, c3, cpw(c0), wcel(c0, c1))
  fmptd(s0, c2, c3, cpw(c0), crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wcel(c0, c1))
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c3), wcel(crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))), cpw(c0)))
  mpbiri(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))), cpw(c0)), wss(crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))), c0))
  ssrab2(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  elpw2g(c0, c1, crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, c1)
}

  mpbiri(c0 âˆˆ c1, { s1 âˆˆ c0 | s0 âˆˆ s1 } âˆˆ P(c0), { s1 âˆˆ c0 | s0 âˆˆ s1 } âŠ† c0)

blocks.name: kqval
blocks.content: Value of the quotient topology function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm kqval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  eqtr4d(cfv(ckq, c0), co(c0, cqtop, c2), co(c0, cqtop, cmpt(s0, cuni(c0), crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wceq(cfv(ckq, c0), co(c0, cqtop, cmpt(s0, cuni(c0), crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))), wcel(c0, ctop))
  topontop(c0, c1)
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, ctop, ckq, co(c0, cqtop, cmpt(s0, cuni(c0), crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), co(cv(hs0), cqtop, cmpt(s0, cuni(cv(hs0)), crab(s1, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  oveq12d(cv(hs0), cqtop, cmpt(s0, cuni(cv(hs0)), crab(s1, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), c0, cmpt(s0, cuni(c0), crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  mpteq12dv(s0, cuni(cv(hs0)), crab(s1, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))), cuni(c0), crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  unieq(cv(hs0), c0)
  rabeq(s1, cv(hs0), c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  df-kq(hs0, s0, s1)
  ovex(c0, cqtop, cmpt(s0, cuni(c0), crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  oveq2d(c0, cqtop, c2, cmpt(s0, cuni(c0), crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)))
  syl5eq(c2, cmpt(s0, cuni(c0), crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), cmpt(s0, c1, crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)))
  mpteq1d(s0, c1, crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))), cuni(c0), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)))
  toponuni(c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(ctop)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, cqtop, cmpt(s0, cuni(c0), crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cuni.s(s0, c0)
}

  topontop(c0, c1)

  oveq12d(hs0, cqtop, (s0 âˆˆ â‹ƒ hs0 â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ hs0 | s0 âˆˆ s1 }), c0, (s0 âˆˆ â‹ƒ c0 â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ c0 | s0 âˆˆ s1 }), hs0 = c0)
  id(hs0 = c0)
  mpteq12dv(s0, â‹ƒ hs0, { s1 âˆˆ hs0 | s0 âˆˆ s1 }, â‹ƒ c0, { s1 âˆˆ c0 | s0 âˆˆ s1 }, hs0 = c0)
  unieq(hs0, c0)
  rabeq(s1, hs0, c0, s0 âˆˆ s1)
  df-kq(hs0, s0, s1)
  ovex(c0, cqtop, (s0 âˆˆ â‹ƒ c0 â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ c0 | s0 âˆˆ s1 }))
  oveq2d(c0, cqtop, c2, (s0 âˆˆ â‹ƒ c0 â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ c0 | s0 âˆˆ s1 }), c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1))
  syl5eq(c2, (s0 âˆˆ â‹ƒ c0 â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ c0 | s0 âˆˆ s1 }), (s0 âˆˆ c1 â†¦ { s1 âˆˆ c0 | s0 âˆˆ s1 }), c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1))
  mpteq1d(s0, c1, { s1 âˆˆ c0 | s0 âˆˆ s1 }, â‹ƒ c0, c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1))
  toponuni(c0, c1)

blocks.name: kqtopon
blocks.content: The Kolmogorov quotient is a topology on the quotient set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm kqtopon(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), cfv(ctopon, crn(c2))))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, c1, crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  eqeltrd(cfv(ckq, c0), cfv(ctopon, crn(c2)), co(c0, cqtop, c2), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)))
  kqval(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2)

  sylib(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wfo(c2, c1, crn(c2)), wfn(c2, c1))

}

blocks.name: kqid
blocks.content: The topological indistinguishability map is a continuous function into the Kolmogorov quotient. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm kqid(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, co(c0, ccn, cfv(ckq, c0))))

  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  eleqtrrd(c2, co(c0, ccn, cfv(ckq, c0)), co(c0, ccn, co(c0, cqtop, c2)), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)))
  mpdan(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, co(c0, ccn, co(c0, cqtop, c2))), wfn(c2, c1))

thm ist0-4(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  imbi1d(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, cv(hs1))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wral(s1, c0, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(s1)))))
  3expb(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1), wb(wceq(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, cv(hs1))), wral(s1, c0, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(s1))))))
  kqfeq(s1, s0, c0, cfv(ctopon, c1), cv(hs0), c1, cv(hs1), c2)
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wb(wf1(c2, c1, universe), wral(hs0, c1, wral(hs1, c1, wi(wceq(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2, cv(hs1))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))), wf(c2, c1, universe))
  sylib(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wf(c2, c1, universe), wfn(c2, c1))

  dff13(hs0, hs1, c2, c1, universe)

  âŠ¢ (c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)â†’(c0 âˆˆ Kol2 â†”(c2 : c1 â†£ ğ•Œ)))

blocks.name: kqfvima
blocks.content: When the image set is open, the quotient map satisfies a partial converse to ~ fnfvima , which is normally only true for injective functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: kqsat
blocks.content: Any open set is saturated with respect to the topological indistinguishability map (in the terminology of ~ qtoprest ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm kqsat(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wceq(cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2)), c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpt(s0, c1, crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  eqssd(cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2)), c2, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)))
  ssrdv(hs0, cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2)), c2, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)))
  sylbid(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2))))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, c0), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)))))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)))), wfn(c3, c1))
  elpreima(c3, c1, cv(hs0), cima(c3, c2))
  expimpd(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  biimprd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  3expa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2))))
  kqfvima(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, cv(hs0), c3)
  syl6eqssr(c2, cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2)), cin(cdm(c3), c2), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)))
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wceq(cin(cdm(c3), c2), c2), wss(c2, cdm(c3)))

blocks.content: Any closed set is saturated with respect to the topological indistinguishability map (in the terminology of ~ qtoprest ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)

thm kqcldsat(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wceq(cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2)), c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpt(s0, c1, crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  eqssd(cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2)), c2, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))))
  ssrdv(hs0, cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2)), c2, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))))
  sylbid(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2))))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)))))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)))), wfn(c3, c1))
  elpreima(c3, c1, cv(hs0), cima(c3, c2))
  expimpd(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  sylibd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wn(wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2)))))
  sylibr(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wi(wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)), wn(wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2))))), wn(wa(wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2))))))
  mtbiri(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wa(wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2)))), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), emptycls))
  noel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)))
  syl5bbr(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wa(wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2)))), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), emptycls), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cin(cima(c3, c2), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2)))))
  elin(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2)))
  eleq2d(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cin(cima(c3, c2), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2))), emptycls, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  syl5eq(cin(cima(c3, c2), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2))), emptycls, cin(cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2)), cima(c3, c2)), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  incom(cima(c3, c2), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2)))
  eqtr3d(cin(cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2)), cima(c3, c2)), emptycls, cin(cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2)), cima(c3, cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c2)))), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  ineq2d(cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2)), cima(c3, cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c2))), cima(c3, c2), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  imaeq2d(c3, cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c2)), c2, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  sylib(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wceq(cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c2)), c2), wss(c2, c1))
  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wss(c2, c1))
  sseqtrd(c2, c1, cdm(c3), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)), wceq(cdm(c3), c1))
  dfss4(c2, c1)
  syl2anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wceq(cin(cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2)), cima(c3, cdif(c1, cdif(c1, c2)))), emptycls), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(cdif(c1, c2), c0))
  kqdisj(s0, s1, c0, c1, cdif(c1, c2), c3, c1)
  imnan(wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2))))
  con1bid(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  bitrd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2))), wcel(cv(hs0), cdif(c1, c2)))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wb(wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cdif(c1, c2))))
  baibr(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cdif(c1, c2)))
  eldif(cv(hs0), c1, c2)
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cdif(c1, c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, cdif(c1, c2)))), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(cdif(c1, c2), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  simpll(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cdif(c1, c2), c0))
  eqeltrd(cdif(c1, c2), c0, cdif(cuni(c0), c2), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))))
  difeq1d(c1, c2, cuni(c0), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)), wceq(c1, cuni(c0)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)), wcel(cdif(cuni(c0), c2), c0))
  cldopn(c2, c0, cuni(c0))
  simpr(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  kqfvima(s0, s1, c0, c1, cdif(c1, c2), cv(hs0), c3)
  syl6eqssr(c2, cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2)), cin(cdm(c3), c2), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))))
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))), wceq(cin(cdm(c3), c2), c2), wss(c2, cdm(c3)))
  sseqtr4d(c2, cdm(c3), cuni(c0), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)), wss(c2, cuni(c0)))
  cldss(c2, c0, cuni(c0))
  eqid(cuni(c0))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)), wceq(cdm(c3), cuni(c0)))
  eqtrd(cdm(c3), cuni(c0), c1, wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wceq(cdm(c3), c1), wfn(c3, c1))
  kqffn(s0, s1, c0, cfv(ctopon, c1), c3, c1)
  fndm(c3, c1)
  toponuni(c0, c1)
  sseqin2(c2, cdm(c3))
  dminss(c3, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2)))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0))))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ctopon, c1)
  diff.ctopon.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

  âŠ£ d(s1, c0)

  eqssd((`' c3 "(c3 " c2)), c2, (c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ(Clsd ` c0)))

  syl(c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1), (hs0 âˆˆ(`' c3 "(c3 " c2))â†”(hs0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§(c3 ` hs0)âˆˆ(c3 " c2))), c3[Fn]c1)

  mtbiri(((c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ(Clsd ` c0))âˆ§ hs0 âˆˆ c1), ((c3 ` hs0)âˆˆ(c3 " c2)âˆ§(c3 ` hs0)âˆˆ(c3 "(c1 \ c2))), (c3 ` hs0)âˆˆ âˆ…)
  noel((c3 ` hs0))

  elin((c3 ` hs0), (c3 " c2), (c3 "(c1 \ c2)))
  eleq2d((c3 ` hs0), ((c3 " c2)â‹‚(c3 "(c1 \ c2))), emptycls, ((c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ(Clsd ` c0))âˆ§ hs0 âˆˆ c1))
  syl5eq(((c3 " c2)â‹‚(c3 "(c1 \ c2))), emptycls, ((c3 "(c1 \ c2))â‹‚(c3 " c2)), ((c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ(Clsd ` c0))âˆ§ hs0 âˆˆ c1))
  incom((c3 " c2), (c3 "(c1 \ c2)))
  eqtr3d(((c3 "(c1 \ c2))â‹‚(c3 " c2)), emptycls, ((c3 "(c1 \ c2))â‹‚(c3 "(c1 \(c1 \ c2)))), ((c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ(Clsd ` c0))âˆ§ hs0 âˆˆ c1))

blocks.name: kqopn
blocks.content: The topological indistinguishability map is an open map. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm kqopn(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, c0)), wcel(cima(c3, c2), cfv(ckq, c0)))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpt(s0, c1, crab(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {

  âŠ¢ ((c0 âˆˆ(TopOn ` c1)âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ c0)â†’(c3 " c2)âˆˆ(KQ ` c0))

  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c2, cfv(ccld, c0)), wb(wcel(cima(c3, c2), cfv(ccld, co(c0, cqtop, c3))), wa(wss(cima(c3, c2), crn(c3)), wcel(cima(ccnv(c3), cima(c3, c2)), cfv(ccld, c0)))))

blocks.name: isr0
blocks.content: The property " ` J ` is an R_0 space". A space is R_0 if any two topologically distinguishable points are separated (there is an open set containing each one and disjoint from the other). Or in contraposition, if every open set which contains ` x ` also contains ` y ` , so there is no separation, then ` x ` and ` y ` are members of the same open sets. We have chosen not to give this definition a name, because it turns out that a space is R_0 if and only if its Kolmogorov quotient is T_1, so that is what we prove here. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: r0cld
blocks.content: The analogue of the T_1 axiom (singletons are closed) for an R_0 space. In an R_0 space the set of all points topologically indistinguishable from ` A ` is closed. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c3, cmpt(s2, c1, crab(s3, c0, wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)

  -| diffss(s2, s3)

blocks.name: kqreglem2
blocks.content: If the Kolmogorov quotient of a space is regular then so is the original space. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: kqnrmlem2
blocks.content: If the Kolmogorov quotient of a space is normal then so is the original space. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: kqtop
blocks.content: The Kolmogorov quotient is a topology on the quotient set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm kqtop(class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), ctop))
} = {
  impbii(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), ctop))
  syl(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), ctop), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), cfv(ctopon, crn(cmpt(hs0, cuni(c0), crab(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))))))
  sylbi(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), cfv(ctopon, crn(cmpt(hs0, cuni(c0), crab(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))))), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c0))))
  toptopon2(c0)
  kqtopon(hs0, hs1, c0, cuni(c0), cmpt(hs0, cuni(c0), crab(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, cuni(c0), crab(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  topontop(cfv(ckq, c0), crn(cmpt(hs0, cuni(c0), crab(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))))
  syl6eleq(c0, ctop, cdm(ckq), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), ctop))
  syl(wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), ctop), wcel(c0, cdm(ckq)), wcel(emptycls, cfv(ckq, c0)))
  0opn(cfv(ckq, c0))
  elfvdm(emptycls, ckq, c0)
  dmmpti(hs2, ckq, ctop, co(cv(hs2), cqtop, cmpt(hs0, cuni(cv(hs2)), crab(hs1, cv(hs2), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))))
  ovex(cv(hs2), cqtop, cmpt(hs0, cuni(cv(hs2)), crab(hs1, cv(hs2), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  df-kq(hs2, hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(c0))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cuni(c0))
  diff.hs2.c(ctop)
  diff.hs2.s(hs0)
  diff.hs2.s(hs1)
}

blocks.content: The Kolmogorov quotient is T_0 even if the original topology is not. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)

  diff.hs1.c({ hs3 âˆˆ â‹ƒ c0 | âˆ€(hs4 âˆˆ c0,(hs3 âˆˆ hs4 â†” hs0 âˆˆ hs4))})
  diff.hs1.w(((c0 âˆˆ Nrm âˆ§(KQ ` c0)âˆˆ Fre)âˆ§(hs2 âˆˆ c0 âˆ§ hs0 âˆˆ hs2)))
  diff.hs3.w(âˆ€(hs4 âˆˆ c0,(hs0 âˆˆ hs4 â†” hs0 âˆˆ hs4)))
  diff.hs4.w(hs3 = hs0)
  diff.hs4.w(((c0 âˆˆ Nrm âˆ§(KQ ` c0)âˆˆ Fre)âˆ§(hs2 âˆˆ c0 âˆ§ hs0 âˆˆ hs2)))
  diff.hs2.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: regr1
blocks.content: A regular space is R_1, which means that any two topologically distinct points can be separated by neighborhoods. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm regr1(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, creg), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), cha))
} = {
  mpancom(wcel(c0, creg), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), cha), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c0))))
  sylib(wcel(c0, creg), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c0))), wcel(c0, ctop))
  regtop(c0)
  toptopon2(c0)
  regr1lem2(hs0, hs1, c0, cuni(c0), cmpt(hs0, cuni(c0), crab(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, cuni(c0), crab(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(c0))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cuni(c0))
}

  eqid((hs0 âˆˆ â‹ƒ c0 â†¦ { hs1 âˆˆ c0 | hs0 âˆˆ hs1 }))

blocks.name: kqreg
blocks.content: The Kolmogorov quotient of a regular space is regular. By ~ regr1 it is also Hausdorff, so we can also say that a space is regular iff the Kolmogorov quotient is regular Hausdorff (T_3). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm kqreg(class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, creg), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), creg))
} = {
  impbii(wcel(c0, creg), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), creg))
  mpancom(wcel(c0, creg), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), creg), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c0))))
  sylib(wcel(c0, creg), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c0))), wcel(c0, ctop))
  regtop(c0)
  kqreglem1(hs0, hs1, c0, cuni(c0), cmpt(hs0, cuni(c0), crab(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  mpancom(wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), creg), wcel(c0, creg), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c0))))
  sylib(wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), creg), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c0))), wcel(c0, ctop))
  sylibr(wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), creg), wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), ctop))
  regtop(cfv(ckq, c0))
  kqtop(c0)
  toptopon2(c0)
  kqreglem2(hs0, hs1, c0, cuni(c0), cmpt(hs0, cuni(c0), crab(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, cuni(c0), crab(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(c0))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cuni(c0))
}

blocks.name: kqnrm
blocks.content: The Kolmogorov quotient of a normal space is normal. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm kqnrm(class c0) {

  sylib(wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), cnrm), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cuni(c0))), wcel(c0, ctop))
  sylibr(wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), cnrm), wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cfv(ckq, c0), ctop))
  nrmtop(cfv(ckq, c0))
  kqtop(c0)
  toptopon2(c0)
  kqnrmlem2(hs0, hs1, c0, cuni(c0), cmpt(hs0, cuni(c0), crab(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, cuni(c0), crab(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(c0))
